thread.title: Admirals give up 6 consecutive goals in loss
thread.title_full: Admirals give up 6 consecutive goals in loss | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: The Virginian-Pilot
title: Admirals give up 6 consecutive goals in loss
text:
ESTERO, Fla. The Florida Everblades scored three goals in both the second and third periods Wednesday night to cruise to a 6-1 ECHL victory over the Norfolk Admirals at Germain Arena.
The Admirals (1-2-0-0)scored first when defenseman Charles-Olivier Roussel's blast from the right point at 7:56 of the second period beat Florida goalie Daniel Altshuller.
But after that, it was all Everblades.
Brant Harris tied the game at 15:16 of the second period with a wrist shot from between the circles.
The Everblades took the lead for good on Matt Marquardt's one-timer from the right wall.
Marquardt added another goal later in the period.
Kevin Lynch, Ethan Werek and Harris scored third-period goals.
The Admirals play at Orlando tonight and Saturday night.
